content.description: Climb thin edges to reach the right arcing, overhanging finger crack created between a flake and boulder. A series of underclings lead to the top
content.location: Center Wave area, on the south side of one of the highest boulders in the group

climbs.name: Not Bad For A Fat Guy

content.description: Start sitting down in the trough with left hand on great sidepull and right on good undercling/pinch. A very fun problem with great movement.
content.location: This route is located on the uphill, eastern portion of the Center Wave. Look for a large rotten mushroom boulder, hike west, and then look downhill. The problem is located on the far left (when facing downhill) of the group of boulders.

content.description: Really high quality roof crack, start as low as you feel you ought  to, traverse right into the difficulty, use knee bars and some funk to traverse to the lip and then execute the fairly ticky top out.
content.protection: pad spotter could be nice as the top out has an awkward boulder below, but  its a lowball
content.location: from frog pond area go left staying low (towards  the summit trail). stay off the rock, fairly visible trail follows a small sometimes dry creek (in between the large trail you take to frog  pond and the rock). there is a direct trail from the loop trail but it is currently/ permanently  closed (you will see the sign)

content.description: This large jumble of boulders features several V-Hard roofs and highballs. It is located at the base of Main Dome in the center of its south side.
